text.0: with these my hymns i glorify that indra who is alone to be invoked by mortals.
text.1: the lord the mighty one of manly vigour victorious hero true and full of wisdom.
text.2: our sires of old navagvas sages seven while urging him to show his might extolled him.
text.3: dwelling on heights swift smiting down opponents guileless in word and in his thoughts most mighty.
text.4: we seek that indra to obtain his riches that bring much food and men and store of heroes.
text.5: bring us lord of bay steeds to make us joyful celestial wealth abundant undecaying.
text.6: tell thou us this if at thy hand aforetime the earlier singers have obtained good fortune.
text.7: what is thy share and portion strong subduer asuraslayer rich invoked of many.
text.8: he who for carborne indra armed with thunder hath a hymn craving deeplypiercing fluent.
text.9: who sends a song effectual firmlygrasping and strengthbestowing he comes near the mighty.
text.10: strong of thyself thou by this art hast shattered with thoughtswift parvata him who waxed against thee.
text.11: and mightiest roaring boldly rent in pieces things that were firmly fixed and never shaken.
text.12: him will we fit for you with new devotion the strongest ancient one in ancient manner.
text.13: so may that indra boundless faithful leader conduct us oer all places hard to traverse.
text.14: thou for the people who oppress hast kindled the earthly firmament and that of heaven.
text.15: with heat o bull on every side consume them heat earth and flood for him who hates devotion.
text.16: of all the heavenly folk of earthly creatures thou art the king o god of splendid aspect.
text.17: in thy right hand o indra grasp die thunder eternal thou destroyest all enchantments.
text.18: give us confirmed prosperity o indra vast and exhaustless for the foes subduing.
text.19: strengthen therewith the Āryas hate and dāsas and let the arms of nahusas be mighty.
text.20: come with thy team which brings all blessings hither disposer muchinvoked exceeding holy.
text.21: thou whom no fiend no god can stay or hinder come swittly with these steeds in my direction.
